org.apache.mesos.offer

Class OfferRequirement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.offer.OfferRequirement

  • public class OfferRequirement
extends java.lang.Object
    An OfferRequirement encapsulates the needed resources an Offer must have. In general these are Resource requirements like it must have a certain amount of cpu, memory, and disk. Additionally it has two modes regarding expectations around Persistent Volumes. In the CREATE mode it anticipates that the Scheduler will be creating the required volume, so a Volume with a particular persistence id is not required to be already present in an Offer. In the EXISTING mode, we expect that an Offer will already have the indicated persistence ID.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OfferRequirement

        public OfferRequirement(java.lang.String taskType,
                        java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> taskInfos,
                        java.util.Optional<ExecutorInfo> executorInfoOptional,
                        java.util.Optional<PlacementRuleGenerator> placementRuleGeneratorOptional)
                 throws InvalidRequirementException
        Creates a new OfferRequirement.
        Parameters:
        taskType - the task type name from the TaskSet, used for placement filtering
        taskInfos - the 'draft' TaskInfos from which task requirements should be generated
        executorInfoOptional - the executor from which an executor requirement should be generated, if any
        placementRuleGeneratorOptional - the placement constraints which should be applied to the tasks, if any
        Throws:
        InvalidRequirementException - if task or executor requirements could not be generated from the provided information
